meanings.definition: A type of cell in the nervous system that provides support and protection for neurons.
meanings.sent1: The glia in the nervous system help protect the neurons.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how glia support the neurons in our brains.
meanings.sent3: The glia threw a tiny party to celebrate keeping the neurons safe.
meanings.sent4: Like guardian angels, glia shield the neurons from harm.
meanings.sent5: Imagine glia as the bodyguards of the neurons, always vigilant and ready to defend.

meanings.definition: The connective tissue of the nervous system, consisting of several different types of cells.
meanings.sent1: Scientists are researching the functions of glia in the nervous system.
meanings.sent2: The glia form a crucial part of the nervous system's structure.
meanings.sent3: The glia decided to have a picnic to connect better with each other.
meanings.sent4: In the intricate web of the nervous system, glia are the threads that hold everything together.
meanings.sent5: Picture the glia as the glue that binds the nervous system, ensuring everything stays in place.
